result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas A Thiel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 109 Days were granted.
**PER DOC, SENTENCE CREDIT AMENDED TO 103 DAYS.
Consecutive to: Present Sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution from case 13CF1534 of $558.52. Balance and Restitution from this case $724.50 to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Comply with any Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Cases 13CF1534, 13CM2050, 14CT029 & 14CT0167 were dismissed and read in. No Contact with any victims listed in the criminal complaints including read-in cases. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
01/13/15  COURT ORDERED FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS AND RESTITUTION PAYABLE OUT OF 25% OF INMATE'S FUNDS WHILE INCARCERATED.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 07/30/14 plea/sentencing date.   Original to be held in 2013CF1534.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Douglas A Thiel in court, in custody, with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant entered a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 109 days)   **CONSECUTIVE TO PRESENT SENTENCE**
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: any victims listed in criminal complaints (to include read-in cases)
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

RESTITUTION:  $724.50  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)
                          $558.52 on Case #13CF1534  (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($250.00) and remainder=$308.52 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)
COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
